snippet: Little has been done in Western capitals to stop or mitigate the slow-motion disaster that was befalling Syrian civilians and sending them on the run.
abstract: Backlash against European nations and their leaders grows as disturbing images of desperate Syrian refugees flood worldwide media; critics say West has done little to help broker political solutions to crisis in Syria to avoid such wholesale flight, and they have not developed humanitarian aid programs that could help migrants settle more quickly and safely once reaching European shores.

byline.contributor: Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Istanbul, Hwaida Saad from Beirut, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: Little has been done in Western capitals to stop or mitigate the slow-motion disaster that was befalling Syrian civilians and sending them on the run.

headline.main: Exodus of Syrians Highlights Political Failure of the West
headline.print_headline: Critics Blame a Passive West as Syrians Flee

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
